website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few quirks, this scale offers convenient features, good looks, and reliable accuracy.
pros: Sports a convenient pull-out display that's easy to read even when weighing large items
cons: Can be slow to recalculate when adding or removing ingredients
Control panel has been reported to quit working if liquids are spilled on it

customer_reviews.title: Works great if there isn't an active phone cellphone near it
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few weeks then decided it no longer wants to weigh properly. Changed the battery. It looks like a poltergeist is playing on screen. Called OXO. It's a known issue. Apparently you can't have an active cell phone near the scale. We went to check it and sure enough, my iPhone (unlocked and sitting within a foot of the scale) made the scale go nuts. Moving the phone away by more than 5 feet or turning it off caused the scale to function correctly. Bizarre issue but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Heller

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: 0 stars if I could. I don’t think OXO did any product testing on this piece of crap. I accidentally spilled probably 2 tbsp of almond milk on the screen while pouring into my cereal. Somehow the liquid immediately soaked into the LCD and clouded the whole screen. Now it’s unreadable. Um...it’s a FOOD scale....you know where it sometimes comes in contact with food. You should make it just a little liquid proof...
customer_reviews.author: GuacamoleHandz

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very nice scale. Checked the accuracy with class 1 weights between 1 gram to 500 grams and every check was dead on. The pros are that the platform is removable, it uses AAA batteries (rather than Li CR2032 batteries), no imperial/metric switch on bottom of the unit and the scale has a small footprint and is very stable. The only con is that there is no backlit display; but then, the scale would probably require 4 batteries rather than 2.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D. Hendon

customer_reviews.title: Product stopped working after a few months. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My Oxo food scale no longer works. I have reset it and changed out the old batteries for brand new ones. When I hit the "On" button, the number in the "weight" field jumps up and down (I.e. 5oz, 4 oz, 3+1/2 oz., 3+1/4oz., 3+1/2oz., 3+3/8oz., etc.) . The scale will no longer "zero out." This is when there is absolutely nothing on the scale. When you put something on it, it jumps around even more. Unfortunately, this is a problem as I need to weigh and measure all of my food. I would be open to a replacement as I believe mine may be defective?
customer_reviews.author: Sara Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great scale for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This scale was bought so that I could switch back and forth from regular measurements to metric. I love the fact that you can 'disconnect' the area the has the read out for when you have really big bowls. I have used it for making recipes from various parts of the world and this makes it really easy. I would buy it again. Been using it now for about 8 months and have never changed the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: DRG

customer_reviews.title: Bought this scale January 2020, June it died.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scale January 2020, June it died. Number couldn’t be read any more. Changed batteries, still wouldn’t show numbers normally. 6 months is not much of a life span!
customer_reviews.author: Atlantic Aviator

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for meal prepping
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few months and have experiences no issues with it. Love that I can flip flop between grams or ounces when needed, and it's been perfect for meal prep.
customer_reviews.author: Nikko and Doug

customer_reviews.title: You won't like this scale.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to assume that the scale is accurate. What I don't like is that the pull-out control panel (that is potentially beneficial if you have something large on the scale) is wobbly when in place. It attaches in the middle (where there are no buttons) but when you touch either control button on left or right the whole panel disconnects and wobbles. Bad design and very annoying to use. Sorry that I already tossed the packaging so I can't send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade!!
customer_reviews.text: I already had an electronic scale for weighing ingredients but upgraded to a new one based on Ken Forkish’s recommendation. The pull out display is amazing when you are trying to weight ingredients in a larger container. Accuracy is spot on and the bread I made with the measurements used from this device was delicious! I still have my old scale because it was easier to wrap with plastic when I had to weigh meat. I wouldn’t want to do that to this scale. I would have to put a container down first which is fine. I am glad I upgraded!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: it's not very good at fine measurements
customer_reviews.text: It weighs things! I can see the display with my big mixing bowl on it! Unfortunately, it's not very good at fine measurements, which I discovered when I accidentally added 10g of salt to some bread when I meant to add 5. If you need any kind of smallish precision when adding ingredients, I'd avoid using the zero function and stick to just remembering how much further you want to go.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Burcalow

customer_reviews.title: Good features. Stopped working proerply 5 months
customer_reviews.text: The scale is convenient, small, and easy to use. Great concept with the pull out display. The scale did not power on recently. I changed the batteries. A couple of days later it powered on; however, it did not change from ounces to grams.
customer_reviews.author: Isaias A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bread baking and using large containers.
customer_reviews.text: A great scale and having the detachable display makes is even better when weighing large size containers. I purchased this scale to weigh flour and water etc. for Artisan Bread Baking following the recipes in Ken Forkish's Book, Flour Water salt Yeast. This is the scale you need to be precise and bake excellent bread.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Less than 6 months and needs new batteries
customer_reviews.text: I haven't experienced any of the inaccuracy issues from other reviews (that I know), but I've had this scale less than 6 months and it's already giving me a low battery error and times out. My cheap scales lasted longer than that. The issue I experience is when you add very light weight at a time. I'll add a bit of flour for example to get to the amount I need, and it won't register anything when I know it should. 3.5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Minerva

customer_reviews.title: Best Digital Scale on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a food plan that requires me to weigh my food portions, and this scale is perfect. It's portable enough to travel with (but remove the batteries first, so it won't stay on), and I like how the controlls can be pulled out if you have large items on the scale. MUCH better than my last digital scale. This one might cost a little more, but it's worth every penny in quality. The only drawback for me is I'd rather the numbers were in decimals instead of fractions, but it's a small detail that I'm figuring it out.
customer_reviews.author: Khumbu0609

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but not very precise
customer_reviews.text: I like to measure in grams. However, if I need 10.5 grams of something, the scale does not show 10.5. The scale shows 10 grams or 11 grams. So, what I do, is play with the ingredients to get the scale's digits to go back and forth between 10 and 11. So, I know I've measured between 10 and 11 but not by how much. It would have been nice if the scale included one decimal place in the weight calculation.
customer_reviews.author: Paola

customer_reviews.title: ) I also like that the small screen is attached to elastic cables ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I buy this scale. I left the first one I bought in my previous apartment. It does its job and has a long battery life. I have never had to change the battery on the first scale I purchased in the 3 years that I had it. (Mind you I've only used it occasionally.) I also like that the small screen is attached to elastic cables and can be pushed forward to read the weight in case a large plate is put on the scale and hides the screen.
customer_reviews.author: cathy sherman

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before fully appreciating how useful it would be and how well designed it is. From the pull out digital display for clear reading when weighing large items, to the super intuitive “zero” button. It has proven reliable and effective for weighing precise coffee, ingredients for baking bread, portions for following diet plans. It is accurate and reliable and simple.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Slow to adjust and indecisive
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to like this scale. It came highly recommended by friends and baking experts alike. It looks great — sleek, smooth, and low-profile. Unfortunately, it didn't hold up to use. It's very slow to change when adding ingredients, and it tends to "waffle" back and forth a few grams at a time, which makes it essentially useless for baking. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great for 4 months now
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for 4 months now. No problems. Used every meal and battery has only been replaced once. Only negative is I would rather see decimal fractions like my old scale for better accuracy. This scale shows weight to 1/8. But it does not shut off in 30 sec. like my old scale. Like that a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scale
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Weight Watchers scale that had quit working. I prefer this one, because it stays on longer. If I am adding food to the scale and I have a long time lapse, the scale stays on for quite awhile. I bought it for the convenience of pulling out the reader portion, but funny thing - I never even use it. But like the scale a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Main Complaint: The Scale is not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: The scale is nice; I’d rather have an illuminate display then the pull-out display, but I prefer above all else that the scale be accurate. At 1.25 lb the scale is 15% off. At 2.5 lb the scale is 10% off.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great for Grams
customer_reviews.text: its an ok scale, very accurate but when its measuring in ounces you dont get a decimal reading but rather 1/4 or 1/8 or 1/2. This poses a problem because there is a lot of play it what it considers half an ounce, about 3 grams of play, and when your brewing beer that's a lot of hops! and can and probably will change your recipe. As long as you use the grams and convert everything over its a great scale and the detachable face is a big win too
customer_reviews.author: merlin696

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have decimal units, only fractions of an ounce, like 1 and 5/8 oz. why????? Update: it’s totally broken. It does t read accurately, not even close. It goes from 1 oz to 42 oz, do 3 oz. total garbage
customer_reviews.author: C. Crome

customer_reviews.title: It's fine.  Weird display for the ounces.
customer_reviews.text: The cord on the display pull out is too short. Also, I don't like the way the ounces are displayed, in fractions. I mean, I can remember that 1/2 is bigger than 3/8, but it would be easier to weigh out ingredients if the display were just decimal. They are for the grams unit choice.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Price

customer_reviews.title: Oxo makes the best stuff. Tare weight function indispensable for weighing food
customer_reviews.text: Oxo makes the best stuff. Tare weight function indispensable for weighing food. Only complaint is the battery graphic.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Kawada

customer_reviews.title: One of the best kitchen food scales out there.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best kitchen food scales out there. I was looking at about 5 of them and i decided to buy this one mainly because the pull out screen. That way i can place a big dinner plate still be able to read the weight on the screen. The screen does not have a back light but i never cook or use this in complete darkness so if you need to weight things on a dark back alley then this is not the scale you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: scale
customer_reviews.text: i really liked this scale, since the weight area comes comes and you can put a larger plate on it and still read the amount. also it will go back to zero. love this scale
customer_reviews.author: precious

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use
customer_reviews.text: This scale is perfect for measuring out coffee beans for roasting, that's what I bought it for and use it for. Accurate and easy to use. And, the driver took a picture of the delivered product on my porch, I wish all the drivers would do this, as I have a had several deliveries stated "delivered" that weren't delivered to my address.
customer_reviews.author: 6xagrampa

customer_reviews.title: Gives weight with fractions rather than decimals
customer_reviews.text: I purchased intending to use for soap making. While it does give the measures it gives the partials in fractions rather than in decimals which would be easier for doing the math calculations. I need them to be in decimals I am returning to get something that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: dcg

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why it errors out all the time
customer_reviews.text: This has happened several times while measuring flour in 1000g quantities, crapping out and some point after 500g. This scale should go well over 2000g so not sure what's up. Whether I go slowly or quickly, it will error out but not every time. Otherwise, I've dropped it twice (it was erroring right out of the box, so that predated being dropped) and it still works! I'd give more stars if not for the annoying errors which make me have to start all over with measuring.
customer_reviews.author: Delores A. Morgano

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use accurate scale.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, I just wish they’d sell disposable weighing boats like we had in the lab. It would make weighing foods a lot less messy. Great scale, this is my second one because we have two homes. They’re very durable - like all OXO items.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen scale
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kitchen scale. Switches between grams and ounces, very easy to use and has a decent capacity. A touch difficult to clean between the scale and the readout, but only a touch. I use this every day.
customer_reviews.author: echo21

customer_reviews.title: Great little scale...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. The pull-out display is nice to still be able to see the weight when you're putting a large plate or other container on it, so that's definitely a plus. The only downside is that it's a little touchy if you're trying to add small amounts of certain types of food when you try to get it down to the gram. Basically it'll "stick" to a certain count (ex. 9 grams) and then as you add little by little, it might jump up a little much (ex 12 grams). Not a huge deal and doesn't happen all the time, but something to keep in mind if you need to use it repeatedly for very specific small measurements.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: innacurate weight indication renders this scale irrelevant
customer_reviews.text: I was wieghing some herbs and 7 grams came out as 1/8 oz, but 7 grams is a hair shy of 1/4 oz . that's wildly inaccurate. What good is this thing if it won't accurately fractionalize ounces? I want my money back and a more accurate scale. I'm not holding my breath....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST kitchen scale ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have had MANY kitchen scales, most of them fairly complex, but cheap. They all were lame in some way or other. I looked at reviews and bought the Oxo, which was a bit more expensive BUT, it is very well made, feels durable, very large size numbers, so it's the easiest to read scale I've ever owned, I can change back and forth from metric to English measurements in one press of a button (which is important to me as a bread-maker, no complicated switches or buttons. The perfect kitchen scale. Love the pull-out front!
customer_reviews.author: J Robert Bercaw

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I’ve cooked for so many years without a scale. I purchased it for perfecting my sourdough bread baking. However, now I find I use it almost daily for all kinds of things in the kitchen as well as weighing oversized envelopes for calculating postage. I’ve only had it a month but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S

customer_reviews.title: Horrible...Fluctuating zero
customer_reviews.text: wouldn't stay zeroed out. Kept fluctuating. To late to return, wasted money...gave it to Salvation Army.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for so many uses.
customer_reviews.text: Love this scale. I bought two for gifts because it is such a great item for the kitchen. Easily changes to metric measure for recipes that have amounts in metric so you don't have to convert. Accurate. Batteries last forever. Easy to read. I use mine so often that I'd be lost without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: lasted for 7 years
customer_reviews.text: The digital display on my oxo scale began malfunctioning so I came to Amazon to buy a new one. Amazon told me that I had purchased my scale in 2013. I think 7 years of frequent use is a pretty good record.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Versatility
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly as a kitchen scale, but lately have been using it to weigh items I have for sale online. It works so well for both and having the ability to pull out the readout for weighing larger items is super helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and Functional
customer_reviews.text: We love this food scale for its looks, accuracy and functionality (slide-out display window allows you to place oversize containers on scale and still be able to read the weight). Great value!
customer_reviews.author: LAK

customer_reviews.title: Great for weighing my guinea pig!
customer_reviews.text: Love how the scale part can separate from the reader. I use a rectangular Tupperware to put her in. On ordinary scales the reader would be covered by the container. Genius idea to have the reader pull out! Highly recommend if you have larger containers to use in weighing your item.
customer_reviews.author: Shonta

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like this scale. I was wondering if it'd work alright since I bought the smaller one due to space limitations. Works great. I make French macarons frequently and they require precise weight measurements. This easy to use - the numbers are easy to see and a quick push of a button changes from pounds to grams. I set the bowl on it, clear the weight and begin adding ingredients. I add the almond meal to the proper weight - clear it again - and add the proper weight of sugar. Easy as pie. Use it many times per week.
customer_reviews.author: Rosann Evans

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: My friend was needing a kitchen scale and I bought this based on his needs--cooking/baking for small family-- and a review by Test Kitchens. He said it is easy to use and clean and the price seemed appropriate. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: ACCURACY: Buy the OXO GOOD GRIPS 5lb FOOD SCALE Cook with confidence!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using the OXO GOOD GRIPS 5lb FOOD SCALE because some recipes call for weighted ingredients and I like to be accurate, very easy to use and the pull out screen is a great idea 👍. Don’t know why I waited so long to buy it?
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease of switching from standard to metric. This scale then chooses the correct units. My (cheaper) scale requires toggling through grams, ml (on a scale??) kgs etc. this is easier. The pullout is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: LBJ

customer_reviews.title: Slow and doesn't always work
customer_reviews.text: When working, this scale is slow to give new numbers which makes measuring masses accurately frustrating. Although it also frequently starts reading out seemingly random numbers, even with no load it will scale from double digit negative values all the way up to overloaded. I give a 2nd star only to give credit to the pull-out display. That was the sole reason I purchased this scale. It is an excellent concept as I frequently work with large mixing bowls. If only the scale was more functional...
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Eckerdt

customer_reviews.title: Very neat scale and small enough to travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good scale and is very sensitive and weighs things to the oz. The first we bought our daughter didn’t work, but they replaced it right away and the 2nd one worked fine. It’s got a front piece you can pull out so you can see the numbers with a large plate on the surface. I have one and loved it. This one is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Treker

customer_reviews.title: doesn't weight enough
customer_reviews.text: It is my fault I guess, but it just didn't occur to me that it would only weigh 4lb 7oz and after that it gives an error message. It works well other than that. But if you plan to weigh things you might harvest from your garden get a different scale that will allow you to weigh up to a higher weight.
customer_reviews.author: Deja

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of the scale. It feels like it is made of high quality material. Partially my own fault but I wish that it would not max out at only a couple of kilo's. Also it is hard to clean the part that pulls away from the rest of the scale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricy, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'd been limping an old one along, but when it broke I decided to drop the bucks for the scale that's recommended everywhere. I love this one. The pull-out display makes weighing large dough tubs easy.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: the last scale i had burned through batteries in a matter of days, this has stayed strong for well over a year. love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The pull out screen was a little odd at first, but really helps with big bowls. If the auto-off was a little longer it'd be perfect. I still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Thunes

customer_reviews.title: One weight setting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bc I love that the display pulls out. But it only has one setting and that’s for pounds (or kg). I was hoping it would have a setting like other scales for ounces, grams...nope. It’s unfortunate bc otherwise, it’s a great scale.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: First one final gave up after many years so I ordered a second one. I'll see you again in about 5 years...
customer_reviews.author: RopeMan

customer_reviews.title: Love this scale!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scale for over 3 years and it is still going strong! I love that you are able to zero out the weight of a container before adding the food you want to actually way. Being able to pull the screen away from the body of the scale is incredibly helpful for larger bowls and containers. This was such an amazing guy for a great cause. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hoeffel

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking even cake layers.
customer_reviews.text: Love it for baking. Put your empty cake pan on, zero the scale out, add your batter. Do the same for your other cake layers and there you have it, even cake layers.
customer_reviews.author: MMMLMM

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for what I need
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller then I thought but the display pulls out so I can see the weight even if I put a 10" cake pan on it, seems to be accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Overall it is a good value and works for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: It works well and is small and compact. It does at time seem to be odd in it's calculating depending on how the plate/container is sitting on it. Overall it is a good value and works for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Kitchen Scale
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scale years ago and it served me well. It's pretty much the perfect, reliable kitchen scale and the movable display is a must-have once you've gotten used to having one. I spilled liquid into it one too many times and I had to order a replacement. It works just as well now as it did years ago.
customer_reviews.author: KarlaJamaica

customer_reviews.title: No calibration...
customer_reviews.text: Must be perfectly level if you want to be close. Its great it you dont need to be exact. No calibration which is odd
customer_reviews.author: FrankieBullfloats

customer_reviews.title: Good scale , but
customer_reviews.text: Just getting new one, a little dampness got in scale cannot see numbers well . First time this happened, always in kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jane G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This scale is wonderful! I love that you can pull out the digital reading pane so if your food/plate hangs over the edge, you can still read it. It is super easy to use. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Buy the one that lights up!
customer_reviews.text: I LoVe it! However I wish I would have bought the one with the light it would have been worth more money!
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Oxo converts grams to ounces and vice versa!
customer_reviews.text: I’m interested in calorie counting — it’s convenient that the scale can convert ounces to grams and Grans to ounces since some Keller Eve values come first in grams which is not my metric
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Stone

customer_reviews.title: Love this little food scale
customer_reviews.text: This will enable me to accurately weigh my portions and help control my food intake.
customer_reviews.author: CYNDYLU

customer_reviews.title: Perfect scale for Bright Line Eating
customer_reviews.text: it is particularly useful that the indicator pulls away from the scale so that large bowels or plates can be used while still seeing the weight details.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Quick and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has made this guy a happy guy. Quick and accurate every time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I would go with a lit screen next time but I am pleased with it so far. The detachable panel makes weighing a breeze with a larger bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: This is so nice because it doesn’t turn odd when you are cutting things to add to your salad or other meals. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: Great scale!
customer_reviews.text: Love this food scale. Super easy to use and I love that the screen pops out so I can put big things on it
customer_reviews.author: Molly S

customer_reviews.title: Love my OXO food scale
customer_reviews.text: My first OXO food scale lasted like 10 years. It stopped working suddenly, and new batteries, cleaning and DIY fix hacks wouldn't fix it. Post-mortem autopsy could not determine cause of failure but it was fun seeing the inner workings of the device! Happy with the new scale, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: kcuneo

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I had an off brand that I "saved some money on" and, as usual, you get what you pay for. This scale is accurate, fast and about as good as it gets!
customer_reviews.author: M. T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint with excellent capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: Needed scale to improve my bread making skills. I ordered this based upon recommendation of a bread making friend. It’s small size is a real plus with limited kitchen space. Stores out of the way in coffee mug cabinet when not in use. The pull out display makes reading very easy even with oversized bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Donald B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Came with batteries. Works as needed Plan to use to weigh fiber for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pull out Monitor makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very accurate. And it’s great that you can pull out the readout from under a large bowl or plate and see what it says. The only improvement would be if the readout was somehow backlit or had a light.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Giver

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic with retractable read out!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The read out separates from the scale making it easy to weigh food on dinner plates without having to clean a separate container!! I dropped it on the floor and knocked the scale surface clear off the scale. It attached easily and keeps working! So, I would say yes to durable.
customer_reviews.author: Liz B. Goode

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this scale
customer_reviews.text: Great scale. Got it to replace our older Taylor one and the quality of this is great. Love that I can pull it out to use with larger plates that would normally block the weight reader.
customer_reviews.author: James Gando

customer_reviews.title: Ok for larger quantities.
customer_reviews.text: I use a scale for bread and other dough making. I have a small scale that has 1/10 gram accuracy that I was hoping to replace with something larger. The OXO has only 1 gram accuracy and I find that it rounds either up or down inconsistently making it unusable for smaller quantities. Works ok for larger amounts like flour which is in the 100s of grams.The pullout display is a nice feature. The tare reset is nice but that is expected on any decent scale.
customer_reviews.author: Winemaker949

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Accurate, Uses AAA Batteries.  Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, accurate, and used plain old AAA batteries. The display pulls away from the base allowing you to place large bowls on it and still see & operate the device. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. King

customer_reviews.title: Great Scale
customer_reviews.text: Love this scale! Front pulls out so you can see scale with larger bowls
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis C.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, and convenient scale!
customer_reviews.text: Small, convenient scale. Very accurate and I love the ability to pull out the display in case I’m using a large plate. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Marita Wallace

customer_reviews.title: The best, SMART DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: Favorite food scale, love you can pull out the digital read portion when the plate or bowl is large so you can read it. Just an awesome product, have owned 3 (only breaks if my family sets in a puddle on the counter!)
customer_reviews.author: svsutej

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best scale ever!!! Easy to use for both small and large bowls/plates. Arrived on time and very well wrapped.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Violet

customer_reviews.title: Accurate fast and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate fast and convenient. The face pulls away to accommodate larger plates, and the surface is detachable for easy cleaning. A must have for calorie counters.
customer_reviews.author: knewcomb

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This scale is accurate, easy to clean and store. Perfect for baking.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Millan

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: simple, easy to use. wish it had a longer auto-off timer, or could be disabled. once it powers off, you lose your tare.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste your money. this is the second one i bought. lasted 35 days
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: This Digital Food Scale works exactly like it is advertised. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L. Mayle

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. Originally purchased the less expensive version without the light. You get what you pay for! Get this one first and save yourself the disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Bev Mc.

customer_reviews.title: Scale
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Easy to use. Oxo usually makes a good product. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for a while and use it for measuring coffee beans daily and baking once a week or so. Works great. When you turn it on it has a little 3 2 1 countdown which is kind of annoying but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Thorburn C. Duryea

customer_reviews.title: Works really well for home-baker needs
customer_reviews.text: With the large pull-out display a container with a large base can be used for ingredients. Small storage footprint with large scale usability.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Hendricksen

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale daily for cooking and baking at home. It is accurate and seems well constructed. The pull out display is much more useful than I expected it to be. It makes weighing ingredients in a large bowl very easy. Would like to see a way to switch from pounds:oz to just oz. It will display 1lb 1oz, not 17oz. Not a major concern though.
customer_reviews.author: tech archer

customer_reviews.title: Good for heavy weights, terrible for very light weights
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, but I expected better accuracy, especially for smaller weights. Light spice weights don't even register.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K Clawson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Scale!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scale! Got this so I could determine true serving portions. It's easy to use, weighs in ounces and grams, can be zero'd out, and it's easy to wipe clean. I am very happy I went with this model since the display can be pulled away from the main unit, it allows me to use a plate when weighing items and sill be able to view the display.
customer_reviews.author: Kas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little scale
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale at least twice a day to measure food for my son who has type 1 diabetes. It works fantastically and is small enough to stay out on my counter unobtrusively. I love that the front can be pulled out so I can see the measurement around large plates or bowls. Just make sure not to touch it while it counts down when it turns on--it will not be able to measure appropriately if you move it or touch it while it calibrates. I couldn't live without this scale!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect scale
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this brand, we have another, bigger scale that is great. But what I did not like was that this one did not have a light, easy to calibrate. If it had light, would have been five stars
customer_reviews.author: anthony casillas

customer_reviews.title: I own 2-3 of these scales in different models. ...
customer_reviews.text: I own 2-3 of these scales in different models. After a few months to a 1.5 years the lcd usually quits working, displaying weird numbers. Sent it back for replacement. These scales only last a few months to a year. They seem to have a issue with their LCD displays across the entire company scale line.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Au

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice size food scale which fits nicely on my countertop
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size food scale which fits nicely on my countertop. I love the pull out weight reader. Works as expected, and I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wermuth

product_meta.title: OXO 1157100 Good Grips 5 Lb Food Scale with Pull-Out Display,Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackDurable Product

BRAND STORY
By OXO
feature_bullets: Display pulls away from base to prevent shadowing from large plates or bowls
Convenient indicator displays how much capacity is left on the Scale
Zero function allows for zeroing Scale before adding additional ingredients
Measures in 1/8-oz (imperial) and 1-g (metric) increments for greater accuracy
Platform can be removed and washed by hand only
Thin profile allows for easy storage
